bug.description:
Transferred from <denchmark-link:http://code.opencv.org/issues/3897>http://code.opencv.org/issues/3897</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>|| Lê Khánh Thành on 2014-09-06 09:24 || Priority: Normal || Affected: branch 'master' (3.0-dev) || Category: legacy, contrib || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: || PR: || Platform: x86 / Windows </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>opencv 3.0 alpha - opencv_adas300(d).lib not generated</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Hi,
opencv_adas module don't generate opencv_adas300(d).lib but OpenCVModules.cmake import it. The CMake says:
@CMake Error at D:/opencv/build/install/x86/vc11/lib/OpenCVModoules.cmake:187 (message): The imported target "opencv_adas" references the file "D:/opencv/build/install/x86/vc11/lib/opencv_adas300d.lib" but this file does not exist. Possible reasons include:....@
Is this a opencv bug? </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h5>Lê Khánh Thành on 2014-09-06 09:25</denchmark-h>

<denchmark-code>- Category set to legacy, contrib </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Philipp Hasper on 2014-12-10 17:48</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>This behavior also canceled my CMake generation. I can't build OpenCV when adas is activated. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Maksim Shabunin on 2015-04-27 09:11</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>- Target version changed from 3.0-alpha to 3.0 </denchmark-code>
